Summary.description: Hardworking, quick learner, and highly motivated to succeed in every endeavor.
Summary.introduction: Greetings! I'm Dr. Hackman, a computer science enthusiast with an insatiable curiosity for data science. I obtained my Ph.D. degree from National Chiao Tung University, where I also completed a one-year postdoc fellowship. For both my Ph.D. and fellowship, I was supervised by Prof. Vincent S. Tseng. Prior to this, I earned my master's in computer science from Yuan Ze University and my bachelor's in computer science from The University of The Gambia. My Ph.D. dissertation is titled A Study on Trend Analysis in High Utility Itemset Mining. My research interests include data mining, machine learning, medical AI, deep learning, generative AI, and data analytics. Currently, my research is focused on the medical field, aligning with my current job position. In this role, I aim to develop medical AI models that can make a positive impact on the healthcare sector.

Projects.title: Automatic Segmentation of Membranous Glottal Gap Area with U-Net-based Architecture
Projects.description: Background: Videostroboscopy is a widely used method for investigating vocal fold function. However, evaluating numerical values, such as the membranous glottal gap area, is time-consuming for clinical application. Methods: We enrolled 137 patients and collected 2507 videostroboscopy images. We developed five U-Net-based deep-learning models for automatically masking the membranous glottal gap area.
contribution: Developed a user-friendly interface for medical AI applications.
Performed the ETL for the project.
Trained all deep learning models for the project.
Implemented FastAPI for integration into the hospital's health information system.
Drafted and wrote over 50% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: The best model's IPU iOS score is 0.8503. We integrated the model into the hospital to improve patient care. Our manuscript was accepted for publication.
Projects.challenges: One of the main challenges is that the segmentation output has a condition we referred to as broken edges in some cases. To address this problem, we developed an edge-filling algorithm.

Projects.title: Funduscopic Image Analysis
Projects.description: The primary objective of the Funduscopic Image Analysis project is to conduct a comprehensive examination of funduscopic images, aiming to establish a robust correlation between the status of the fundus and various systemic diseases in patients. Funduscopic images provide valuable insights into the condition of the eye's interior, particularly the retina and optic nerve, and can serve as a non-invasive diagnostic tool for systemic health assessment. This project leverages advanced medical AI techniques to extract meaningful patterns and relationships from funduscopic images, contributing to early disease detection and personalized patient care.
contribution: Developed a user-friendly interface for medical AI applications.
Designed the strategy for model training.
Implemented deep learning methods for funduscopic image analysis.
Drafted and wrote over 70% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: Currently, we have achieved a model accuracy of 91%, and our manuscript is nearing completion for submission.
Projects.challenges: As the sole technical member on the team, overcoming challenges included learning and adapting to new technologies and tools.

Projects.title: Large Language Model for ICD Coding
Projects.description: Automation of ICD (International Classification of Diseases) code prediction from medical records. In this project, the goal is to finetune open source large language models to predict ICD codes from medical records. The current manual process of assigning ICD codes to diseases is prone to errors and can be subjective to human interpretation.
contribution: Data clearning and preprocessing.
Developed the strateggies to finetune the models.
User interface development for ICD coding.
Drafted an wrote over 98% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: The project has produced an Open Source ICD coder, poised to significantly reduce coding time, with my ongoing commitment to optimize its use.
Projects.challenges: Managing the dataset presented a significant challenge, necessitating innovative strategies for information extraction and model-friendly representation.

Projects.title: Skin Lesion detection and Classification
Projects.description: Using over three thousand images from the EHR system of Changhua Christian Hospital, we aim to develop a model to detect skin lesions and classify them into different categories.
contribution: Prepared the dataset for training.
Trained the models for classification.
Built the user interface for the model.
Projects.outcome: Our initial accuracy on the binary classfication task was 92%, but we are working on improving the model's performance and increase the number of classes.
Projects.challenges: There are serveral artifacts on the dataset that needs to be removed. Our first approach was to use cropping to avoid the artifacts, we hope to test out other approaches in the future.

Projects.title: Detection of LVI from WSI using deep learning methods
Projects.description: The use of Lymphovascular Invation(LVI) is a well studied application of using deep learning in pathology. However, in our hospital, we are developing a deep learning model to identify LVI and implement a report generator to help reduce the work load of the pathologist.
contribution: Data cleaning and preprocessing.
Model building and training.
User interface development for LVI detection.
Projects.outcome: Our developed platform can identify the precesss of LVI in the WSI images with 95% accuracy. Currently we are intigrating the model inference into a report generation framework.
Projects.challenges: The size of each Whole Slide Image is significanly large, for this, we used a slicing strategy to process each image.

Projects.title: No-Code Low-Code AutoML Platform for Medical AI Applications
Projects.description: This project is aimed at producing a userfirendly platform that medical professionals can use without the need for any coding. Domain experts in data science can also use this application to build their own models.
contribution: Designed the project architecture.
Developed the user management module
Developed the MVP of the Low-code Module
Implemented the CSV data import module
Implemended the CSV data cleaning module
Projects.outcome: The current outcome includes the CSV data cleaning module and the low-code module. The low-code module is currently under development.
Projects.challenges: The main challenge in this project is the number of manpower available, we are currently working on finding a solution to this problem when the funding goes through.

Projects.title: Denial of Service Attack Detection
Projects.description: dentifying and mitigating distributed denial of service attacks using deep learning methods
contribution: Designed and built a simulator the project.
My role included performing ETL for parameter selection.
Projects.outcome: We provided a parameter list for more efficient model development.  An accuracy of over 90% in the initial phase.
Projects.challenges: The main challenge for this project was working with an unfinished hardware. To address this, we developed a simulator to generate data based on open source dataset specification like the CIC-IDS2017 dataset and the specifications the hardware device.

Projects.title: Diagnoses of Multiple Sclerosis Using Deep Learning Methods
Projects.description: We built a model to classify multiple sclerosis patients
contribution: Performed the ETL for the project.
Built different models for comparison.
Projects.outcome: We built five models for comparison. Our best model scored over 82% accuracy.
Projects.challenges: Although the timeline on the project wasn't strict, however, being the only member working on this project required I spent longer hours in the lab to complete the task.

Projects.title: Survey of Continual Learning Frameworks
Projects.description: This was the priliminary study for a collaboration project. Unfortunately the project was not awards to my lab.
contribution: Survyed many papers on continual learning.
Tabulated and documented the survyed materials.
Projects.outcome: Though the project did not materialized but the task of surveying for this project gave a better understanding of continual learning frameworks and their applications.

Projects.title: Trend Analysis in Utility Pattern Mining
Projects.description: Expand and significantly contribute to the utility pattern mining research.

funding.by: Supported by Ministry of Science and Technology

contribution: Surveyed and tabulated many utility pattern mining publications
proposed and designed mining algorithms.
Implemented mining algorithm in both java and python programming languages.
Drafted and published academic papers in international conferences.
Projects.outcome: We proposed applications of utility pattern mining by introducing the following itemsets; Trending High Utility Itemsets. Emerging High Utility Itemsets. Stable High Utility Itemsets. We published three academic papers in international conferences.
Projects.challenges: Published research work in the area of high utility itemset mining has very excellent algorithms that are already archiving excellent results. To manage this challenge and make better contribution, we proposed applications for variations of the HUIM problem.
